title: Someone went and made a Batman smartwatch where you fight crime with your steps | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Batman
Smartwatch](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

  * [CES](https://www.trustedreviews.com/tag/ces)

**If you’ve always wanted your smartwatch to have a superhero theme, this
range of wearables from One61 Studio could be right up your street – but
probably only if you’re a _super_ fan.**

On searching around the show floor of [CES
2018](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/ces-2018-live-news-
highlights-3350586), I wasn’t expecting to find a bunch of smartwatches themed
around a trio of members from the Justice League. But here we are.

One61 Studio has created three smartwatches based around Batman, The Flash and
Wonder Woman, with the lineup really geared towards massive fans of those
comic book franchises. Probably the type of person who would buy the
merchandise from One61 Studio’s parent company, Bioworld Merchandising Inc.

![Batman
Smartwatch](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Are you after a Batman smartwatch to match your Batman backpack, Batman wallet
and Batmam pyjamas? Then read on.

So, since these are smartwatches, they come with the basic stable of features
you’d expect of a wearable that isn’t running a fully fledged OS such as
Android Wear, watchOS or Tizen. These include message notifications, the
ability to take calls from your wrist, plus music and camera controls.

![Batman
Smartwatch](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

There’s also fitness tracking by way of step counting and sleep monitoring. Of
course, all the menus and interactions are skinned in a way to match your
chosen superhero of choice. If you opt for The Flash, you’ll receive move
alerts based around “metahuman alerts”. One61 wants to gamify the fitness side
by providing more character content when you reach certain step milestones
throughout the day.

![Batman
Smartwatch](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

The Batman smartwatch, which is based around the 1960s _Batman_ television
series, will let you defeat the Joker by getting enough steps in. Similarly,
The Flash Smartwatch will play clips from the recent television show for
reaching milestones throughout the day.

![Batman
Smartwatch](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

The Batman and The Flash models will retail for $129; the Wonder Woman model
is a little pricier at $149 when it launches later in the year, but will also
include a heart rate monitor.

One61 Studio says to expect more tie-in smartwatches down the line, including
models based on Rick and Morty.

**What do you think of these superhero smartwatches? Let us know on Facebook
or Twitter.**
